snippet: A decision by ethics regulators will keep secret the identities of a vast majority of millionaire donors who financed a business lobbying group that promotes Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.
abstract: New York State Joint Commission on Public Ethics rules that a 2011 law requires lobbying groups to reveal only the names of donors who have contributed since July 1; decision allows The Committee to Save New York, created days after Gov Andrew M Cuomo's election in November 2010, to keep secret the identities of a vast majority of millionaire donors who financed the group.
lead_paragraph: A decision by ethics regulators will keep secret the identities of a vast majority of millionaire donors who financed a business lobbying group that promotes Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

headline.seo: Ethics Panel Says Pro-Cuomo Lobby May Shield Donors’ Names
headline.main: Pro-Cuomo Lobby Allowed to Hide Donor Names
headline.print_headline: Pro-Cuomo Lobby Allowed to Hide Donor Names
